events.title: The War of the Worlds Radio Broadcast
events.description: Orson Welles' radio adaptation of H.G. Wells' novel 'The War of the Worlds' aired, causing public panic as many listeners believed the fictional alien invasion was real.
events.significance: Demonstrated the power of mass media and its impact on public perception.

events.title: Soviet Union Invades Finland
events.description: The Soviet Union launched an invasion of Finland, beginning the Winter War during World War II.
events.significance: Marked a significant conflict in WWII and showcased Finnish resilience despite Soviet numerical superiority.

events.title: Death of Francisco Franco
events.description: Francisco Franco, the Spanish dictator who ruled Spain since the end of the Spanish Civil War, died.
events.significance: Franco's death led to Spain's transition to democracy after decades of authoritarian rule.

events.title: Yahoo! Launches
events.description: Yahoo! officially launched as a web directory, becoming one of the first major internet portals and search engines.
events.significance: Played a pivotal role in the early development and popularization of the internet.
